Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel at a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Founextravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed three days with my daughter in this nice and beautifully decorated small hotel and wasn't disappointed. Beautiful and clean design room, nice bathroom. Service was OK but not outstanding. Breakfast was very nice. Location is good. On the downside, the hotel is pretty dark and there is no terrace. One has to like small hotels and we missed some life at the bar at evening. All in all, a very nice hotel and worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls,no heat,limited hot water”
Reviews.Author: BeenaroundRj
Reviews.Content: Wonder who wrote all the glowing reviews. Spent two nights here in April 2012. Heat had been turned off and hotel was very cold. Water had to run for a good 15 minutes to get to luke warm. Never got really hot. Shower didn't work properly and glass partition was cracked. But the biggest problem is the lack of insulation in the walls. You can easily hear normal conversation in the room next to you. Turn down service didn't show up first night. Breakfast is simply glorified continental. One person is the front desk manager, bellman, porter and maintenance engineer rolled into one. Hotel was designed to be dramatic but is really just too dark. Staff tries very hard but they can't compensate for issues. We had just spent 5 nights in Florence at the Four Seasons and this hotel was a MAJOR disappointment. Left half way through our reserved stay. Even though I expressed my concerns to the individual in charge of the front desk, no one from management bothered to contact me. Never have I paid so much for a totally second rate stay.

Reviews.Title: “Return visit to Palazzo Barbarigo doesn't fail to disappoint”
Reviews.Author: helenmariemelon
Reviews.Content: Just a little over 12 months ago we visited this beautiful hotel, returning for our 2nd visit via water taxi felt like we had never been away. Familiar faces greeted us making us feel so welcome but this time we had the added benefit of knowing how to find our way around Venice. You can also take a public gondola 2 mins walk away so easily (and cheap 1 euro for 2!) to save walking through congested Rialto bridge. Venice is not cheap and neither is Palazzo Barbarigo, yet it is a beautifully intimate hotel, in a good location, sitting on the balcony with a red wine or negroni overlooking the Grand Canal is fantastic and so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting”
Reviews.Author: weelassieScotland
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay in this lovely hotel. The setting is spectacular. We stayed in room 1 which was one the ground floor overlooking the Grand Canal in fact you felt you were actually on the Grand Canal. We arrived in style by water taxi right up to the front door. I don't think we would ever have found it otherwise as it is reached by a very long narrow lane but once you knew where it was it was a 2 minute walk to San Tomas waterbus stop.The Rialto Bridge is an easy 10 minute walk and St Marks Square about 20 minute walk. In our opinion it was the ideal spot to stay close enough to the centre but far enough away to be more tranquil and detached from day trippers. The room was very comfortable and although not huge it was big enough. The term Junior suite was perhaps a little misleading in that respect. It was very quiet cosidering it was on the Grand Canal. The double glazing was very effective and heavy curtains blocked out the light so much so that we slept in one morning and nearly missed breakfast. Breakfast was very good. Four platters were served at your table one with hams and cheese,one with breads, a fresh fruit platter and pastries. Eggs and bacon were available for a supplement but we were very happy with the selection that we were served. The bar upstairs was a lovely spot to sit with a glass of Pinot Grigio overlooking the canal. Although this is not an inexpensive hotel I felt it was value for money and would recommend to anyone who likes a small hotel with a bit of style.

Reviews.Title: “Small intimate hotel, just perfect for a romantic break...”
Reviews.Author: W52EX
Reviews.Content: We stayed 25 & 26 Feb and the weather was fantastic. We had room 1 which is a junior suite and worth the extra as we had 2 huge windows looking directly on to te grand canal as well as a further window to a side canal. A couple of minor niggles were the lack of a side table to sit at with drinks and perhaps tea/coffee facility in the room. The suite itself is not really a suite, just a bedroom with an en suite bathroom. We never thought it particularly large either unlike other reviewers - good size but not huge. Bathroom was lovely with nice toiletries. Good 'rain' shower but no bath. Service was generally very good but on a couple of times we had to wait at the bar until someone appeared from behind the kitchen door. I would agree it must be difficult to find if arriving via the back door as this is found via a warren of alleys. However, my advice is splash out on a water-taxi from the airport. At â‚¬110 it's not cheap but speeding up to the front door and arriving in style is a must do! We ate at Da Fiore restaurant (see separate review) which is a straightforward 10 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Brooding Venetian romance”
Reviews.Author: Dominic_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Located on the grand canal, sunshine streaming into your room every morning it was stunning. The decor is dark and smouldering, with the highest quality finishes throughout. Black marble floors, 10' high free standing mirrors, the dark yet funky interior added to the romance. I must admit it would be hard to fault the theme and design. It left you feeling relaxed and almost hidden from the bustling canal. Upstairs is a real gem, probably one of the most beautiful bars in Venice, but for residents only, it seems a shame not to share it as it was almost always empty. Stunning desk lines and a long bar with its private balcony on the canal. Not to be missed. Breakfast is simple but perfect. Every day they served a beautiful mix of pastries, fresh fruit all prepared with care. The coffee very well executed as one can expect in Italy. All in all a great breakfast to start the day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: bagpie
Reviews.Content: tThe hotel itself is in a lovely location (if a bit hard to find!) and looks great. The problem for us occured in the customer service. Coming back to the hotel on Saturday night we discovered the room to our door open - it appeared to have been left open when the evening turndown took place as towels had been changed and chocolates put on our pillow etc. As our room was right off the bar this wasn't ideal however, I accept these things happen but of course we made a complaint with reception. The lady on reception wasn't particuarly apologetic but said she would come back to us. This didn't happen so when checking out the next day we again asked about it only to be told curtly 'the maid said she didn't leave it open so you must have, what else do you want me to do.' Apart from the fact that we were out of the hotel at dinner so this was impossible you can imagine service like this took us aback slightly and left a sour end to our stay in this lovely city. Another incident over requesting a drink apparently 10 mins before the bar opened which ended with one hotel staff member shouting at another wasn't great. So yes visit for the location but not for the service you'd expect from a hotel that positions itself as luxurious!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and charming staff”
Reviews.Author: alison186394
Reviews.Content: Finding the Palazzo on a chilly dark afternoon in February is not for the faint hearted. Don't look now sprang to mind as we were directed down a scarily narrow passagway to enter the back of the building. By far the best way would be to get a water taxi and arrive elegantly at the small platform on the Grand Canal and welcomed by the charming desk manager and his staff. The hotel is small,intimate and sexy. It is romantic and dark with big comfy beds and most rooms have a view of either the Grand Canal or one of the little side canals. Venice is totally amazing and this hotel is perfestly situated to be able to explore everywhere on foot. Being on the San Palo side of the canal it is quieter than the other side which I imagine is very desirable as Venice gets more busy. A good breakfast is included and served till 11AM. My only criticism is its very darkly lit in the bathroom so putting makeup on was a challenge. I emerged like a clown. OK for carnival but not clever at other times

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: filippo n
Reviews.Content: I red previous review, and I was aware of the walking entrance of the hotel, not esy to find, but with a map and asking around you will get there. staff told me that neighbour are not allowing to hang hotel signs on their walls. once there the hotel is amazing, nice furniture, excellent bed, with nice linen, very good clima, individually controlled, the staff was very nice and kind. room very quiet. breakfast more than ok, though they dont set up the " classic " buffet. good food quality including fresh fruit, pineapple, tangerine, pear and apple. we had a room on the side canal, with a glimpse of the " grand canal" the hotel fully deserve the 4 stars. price for value 6 stars. I regret i spent one night only. I will not wait another 50 year to travel to Venice again and to the hotel barbarigo.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: toledojay
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Barbarigo is the ideal place to stay in Venice, not only because of its location on the Grand Canal, near the San TomÃ  vaporetto stop, but especially because of its excellent, yet relaxed service and atmosphere. Our room was spacious and comfortable, the staff friendly and very competent and helpful. It's really all you need in a hotel, very elegantly rendered, without hype. I would certainly come back here and recommend it to anyone planning a visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Just like heaven!”
Reviews.Author: ilovethebeach06
Reviews.Content: This is the second city of my Italy trip - first being Rome (see my other review on Hotel Art). Venice has now become my favourite city and Hotel Palazzo Barbarigo, my favourite hotel in Venice! Booked a junior suite and it is just fabuluous. The bed is so comfortable that I just don't feel like getting up! Hotel staff is extremely helpful and friendly. I arrived late Friday afternoon and was desperately needed to do some laundry. The collection time for Friday was over and they were not supposed to have any laundry service on Saturday and Sunday. But the front staff, Daniel managed to get a collection for me and got them delivered back to me on Saturday afternoon! This is what I called GREAT SERVICE! The only complaint I have is the super narrow and quiet lanes leading to hotel - it is super eerie walking there at night! Breakfast was excellent - so much to eat!

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: grumpychef
Reviews.Content: This hotel hardly needs another glowing review, but it is truly excellent. Fabulous location, and a great room, admittedly 'only' a classic room but warm, stylish and comfortable. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly with restaurant recommendations. A particular mention must go to the breakfast. Possibly one of the best-anywhere! Vast quantities of fruit, pastries, cold meats and cheeses are all brought to your table. Not cheap, but worth every euro so book it anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel of our entire trip....just magico!”
Reviews.Author: MaleiaW
Reviews.Content: I booked Palazzo Barbarigo as the first stop on an 18 day European trip celebrating my husband's 50th birthday. It was absolutely perfect. Intimate, sexy and very cozy. By far our favorite hotel on the entire trip along with Santa Catarina in Amalfi. We splurged on Room 10 - the junior suite overlooking the canal and it was fabulous. Lovely attention to details. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but the breakfasts were amongst the best we had the entire trip. Patricia was wonderful - she recommended restaurants each night of our stay and her selections were excellent. I wish I could have had her at every hotel on the trip! Sangal's rooftop dinner was one of our best dining experiences of the entire trip - we also had a wonderful dinner at Linea D'Ombra and for something more casual we ate twice at Muro Frari (very near the hotel) - both meals and service were excellent. At the end of each night, we would enjoy after dinner drinks back at the hotel's very romantic bar on the small balcony overlooking the canal - the perfect ending to each day of long leisurely walks exploring Venice. Throw away your map and just enjoy wandering and soaking in the charm of the back streets. Avoid the crowds of Rialto Bridge and cross the canal the way the locals do - pay one euro via the Traghetto - quick and easy and there is a stop just near the hotel. This was my husband's first trip to Italy and our Venetian experience could not have been more perfect! Grazie!

Reviews.Title: “REALLY FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: LondonGlobalTravel
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is great. The design of the interior is just fantastic. They kept the Venetian spirit but transported it into modern age. It is a lot more design than some of yhe traditional hotels. the location is fantastic. The location shown on the map here on trip advisor is not correct though. The hotel is ON the grand canal. AMAZING views if you get a canal view room. The service was fantastic and staid are very polite. The back entrance is a little hidden and you have to pass a dodgy back alley but what you really want to do is arrive at the front with a boat. Highly recommeded!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent view”
Reviews.Author: 00Mark
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this hotel. It is clean, well kept, great levels of service. The view was amazing, and I suspect it was this that raised the price to such a great height. Oh well, if you are going to pay for a view, this hotel is a great place to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically dark, dreamy, opulent hotel on the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: helenmariemelon
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through mrandmrssmith.com,the review painted an old venetian hideaway for which I thought our first trip to Venice (during Winter) would be well suited. We weren't disappointed, a must to catch your own taxi boat from the airport, stepping from the boat onto your hotel steps from the grand canal, film star style .The interior of the hotel and bedrooms is black, accompanied by glossy black bathrooms and feathered lampshades. Very opulent and causing your eyes to pop when eventually emerging outside. This initimate hotel was fairly quiet giving us the advantage of having the balcony terrace all to ourselves to enjoy our wine. Service is great and discreet,there is no restaurant although breakfasts are to be recommended. Definately come again!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel EVER!”
Reviews.Author: kathryn c
Reviews.Content: We love the slightly cliche 'Boutique hotel' market in the UK and decided to splash out for our visit to Venice. This hotel is AMAZING! The decor is well thought out and of a consistently high standard. Our room itself was beautiful and luxurious, plus it looked out onto the grand canal. You can get a boat to the hotels own dock, and if you get to the bar/breakfast early enough you can sit on the balcony looking over the canal and Rialto bridge for drinks/breakfast. Speaking of breakfast - a feast! We had drinks in the bar every night and the staff were always very friendly and professional. Our only negative would be that, on foot, the hotel in a bit of a nightmare to find. We got a private boat from the airport to the hotel dock, if we had tried to find it ourselves we would have struggled to say the least. However I believe this is the same with a lot of hotels in Venice. Once you know where it is it's fairly easy to direct yourself back, it's so close to the rialto bridge, and from the hotel you can walk to all the beautiful places in Venice, or get a water bus from a minutes walk away. Would 100% love to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “V. Comfortable and relaxing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barndoc
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable and high-end luxury small hotel on the Grand Canal (trip-advisor map pinpoint location is wrong) Fantastic breakfast and v. Obliging service overall Some small caveats that would give this top-marks if remedied: 1. No complimentary water or tea/coffee-making facilities in room 2. No DVD player 3. No ipod-dock or music/clock-radio in room (in the home of Vivaldi!) 4. No hair-conditioner I feel that these are all reasonable and minimum requirements expected at a 4+ star hotel. Minor irritation - automatic toilet lights cut-out before business is completed! Lastly - the is no bath tub (although the shower was fine for us) Nonetheless, we had a fantastic experience in Venice and would return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: tpmack2
Reviews.Content: wonderful hotel, great location modern feel. may be hard to find from airport or train station if you do not take a water taxi but that is the only issue. my husband and i stayed 3 nights and we had a wonderful stay. very nice modern rooms. excellent bathroom and shower. the bar was very nice and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in ancient setting”
Reviews.Author: michaelq92
Reviews.Content: impeccable service, elegant rooms with modern & chic furniture, this is definitely a different venetian hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: EssexGirl76
Reviews.Content: I have recently come back from a two night stay with my mum at this hotel and am already thinking about when I can go back! Firstly let me start by saying that you must book a private water taxi from the airport - it was a fabulous way to arrive and certainly gives you an amazing view of the city as you head towards the hotel on the Grand Canal. It is pricey at 100euros but certainly worth it. I would say that if you plan on taking the vaporetto and then walking the 5-10mins to the hotel that you might get a little lost and you will not get the right first impression of the hotel as it is down some very narrow little alleyways. I personally wouldn't bring children to this hotel (or to the city for that matter as there is so much walking and so many bridges to cross) - I was a little concerned when I saw on the website that it had been voted one of the most romantic hotels, but thankfully my mother and I didn't feel out of place. There are only about 20rooms so it has a very intimate feel and both the breakfast and the drinks served in the bar in the evening were very good. (Tip - sit out on the little balcony overlooking the Grand Canal in the evening with a glass of Bellini!) The rooms are all doubles and we had a lovely room overlooking a side canal. The only point I would make is about the bathroom - as lovely as it is, it is very dark so not great for doing your makeup. There is a great mirror with a little TV in it but unless you leave the door open to the bedroom you cannot hear the TV and personally I would've preferred the mirror to be 'steam free' rather than have a TV in it. The rain shower was lovely but it did have this round 'disc' in the floor of the shower that tilted if I moved my weight which was a little worrying as I kept thinking I might fall over (not entirely sure what it's purpose was). But apart from that small 'gripe' the room was lovely. The surrounding area is also nice and is away from the main tourists hot spots, so go wandering and find some beautiful churches, hidden alleyways and great shops I could go on about how fab this city is but I won't - you just need to go and experience it for yourself!! Just make sure that you stay at the Palazzo Barbarigo!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- great location- great staff”
Reviews.Author: megcoop
Reviews.Content: This hotel is super cute, and very clean/accommodating. It's a design hotel with a cute bar, the bartender is incredibly charming and a massive delicious breakfast is included in the price, so factor that into the cost. The rooms are great, although a little dark, but very comfortable and sleek. The location is also great, don't be fooled or scared by the very long narrow alley to the back entrance (main entrance is on the grand canal)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: before13
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the hotel in June. It was worth every penny! Beautifully decorated, very comfortable and withing walking distance to everything.The staff is top notch! The girls serving breakfast and Alex the bartender were extremely polite, helpful and friendly. If we are fortunate to make it back to Venice for a 3rd time we'd absolutely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Snippetthewhippet
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice and everything was just perfect. The hotel is a real gem. Great location, pleasant, friendly & attentive staff. Wonderful beds and quiet rooms. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: UK-BILLY1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an ideal location right on the grand canal and within walking distance of all the main attractions, Piazza San Marco approx 20 mins, Accademia Bridge 10 mins, Rialto Bridge 10 mins. Stayed in room 10 which is advertised on their website as 'Junior Suite Grand Canal Best View', and it certainly is! It has three large windows two of which have a full front view of the grand canal and the third window has a side view of the grand canal and side canal....expensive yes, but worth it. The only thing I could fault about the room was the fact that there was no dressing table or even a mirror where my girlfriend could do her hair and make up in the bedroom or even plug in a hairdryer, yes there was in the bathroom but not much use when the mirror is misted up because she had just been in the shower or because I was in the shower....a strange omission and not something I would expect to be missing in a hotel of this quality. Also the bed was very firm, too firm for me but certainly not a deal breaker.Breakfast was excellent, a huge spread of pastries, cold meats and cheese, breads and fresh fruits, tea,coffee, orange juice etc. Very good cocktails from the bar, especially mojito's best enjoyed sitting on the small balcony overlooking the grand canal. As stated by many previous reviews arriving by water taxi from the airport directly to the hotels private landing stage is a must, again its expensive at 100 euro but then most things in Venice are. One tip is always take the street/canal map that the hotel give you at all times as you will without doubt get lost at some point (probably several times) around Venice. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, but our trip was ruined by a family, who did not know how to behave”
Reviews.Author: MattDrewry
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying in the Hotel Palazzo Barbarigo. This chic but small boutique hotel set on the Grand Canal in Venice. The hotel is best suited for couples or small groups without children. The service is excellent, breakfast was very good, and the rooms are beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable, and fortunately very well sound proofed, baring in mind we were sharing the hotel with the family from hell. On day one, the hotel posted a note under our door apologising for the noise, and suggesting that we took breakfast after 10am in the morning. The reason being was that they had a family group who were staying in the hotel, who had booked without notifying the hotel that they had a large number of children in their group. The next morning, we took the hotels advice and waited until 10:15am before heading out for breakfast. To set the scene, breakfast is served in the restaurant area, which is basically one end of the bar area. Most of the hotels rooms are located just off of this area, down a short corridor. What faced us that morning was a scene of mayhem. This is a five star hotel, and this family group had taken over most of the tables in the restaurant area, and their children were proceeding to run a mock in the restaurant and bar area, as if it were their personal play ground. The family were barely dressed, with one of the group eating in her dressing gown and slippers, they proceed to â€˜barkâ€™ their orders at the two poor members of staff who were doing their best to cope. That evening we returned to the hotel after having dinner elsewhere, to find that quite drink at the bar was quite impossible, as the family had taken literally every chair in the bar, dragging them in to a circle in the middle of the room, preventing anyone else from using the bar. This family treated the hotel as if it was their personal residence, with little or no regard for any of the other residents, and even less regard for the staff who were doing their upmost to cope. This behaviour continued, until Sunday morning when after a series of complaints by other residents, the hotel manager finally stepped in. The group fortunately left Sunday, leaving the other residents to finally enjoy the piece and quite and ambiance of this first class hotel. I have read what other guests have written about the Hotel Palazzo Barbarigo, but as a seasoned traveller I have two rules, research your choice of hotel, and treat others (including hotel staff) as you would wish to be treated yourself. The Hotel Palazzo Barbarigo is not, and does not pretend to be a â€œfamilyâ€� hotel suitable for young children. It is a small, beautifully decorated, chic and well run haven in this fabulous, but busy city. As for the staff, I found them charming and pleasant, but then again my partner and I tend to treat the staff in the same manner as we expect to be treated. If the hotel could learn anything, they need to get hold of situations like this sooner. Where guests are disruptive, and spoiling the stay of all of the other guests, they should be dealt with swiftly and firmly.

Reviews.Title: “what a disgusting hotel with rude obnoxious staff only interested in status and money”
Reviews.Author: seasonedtraveller092
Reviews.Content: Oh my god! What a hotel!!! Due to work I am forced to travel every month but fortunately get to stay in the best hotels in the world. I booked this hotel as a surprise for my sisters 40th birthday for me and the whoel family - but what a disastor. Valentina took the booking and was fully aware of the family and children that were coming as she wrote on an email that we would need more water taxis due to the amount of strollers we needed..........however just a week before we were due to arrive she emailed me cancelling the booking claiming that she wasnt aware of the children. After she screamed and shouted on the phone she was only willing to reinstate the booking once she found out the family were featured in the Sunday Times Rich List - indicating that if you have a healthy bank balance then you are welcome - if not don't bother. However in hindsight I wish i did cancel the booking there and then as the hotel ruined my trip - the staff we rude, arrogant and obnoxious. I came off a water taxi holding a baby, a stroller and 3 shopping bags and struggled to carry all into the hotel while the man on reception merely watched me and didnt offer any help at all. As Valentina has a habit of lying her comments that we didnt make of the reservations that we had booked is just another lie - we asked to change one but when we were told we couldnt we still went and really enjoyed it. And we made all our own reservations anyway. The only reservation the hotel made for us was a waste of time - it was a fast food chain that we had to walk 25 minutes to get to. We left to the kind words of GOOD RIDDANCE and to be honest we felt the same. The hotel has nice decor but the bathrooms are small, they obvioulsy dont like changing towels as they have complained on the other review and the staff display the most disgusting, insulting language and actions I have ever experienced> I am sure they will respond with a whole reply but as I have mentioned Valentina is an expert at fabricating the truth!!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautifull hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ofabre
Reviews.Content: We stayed in suite NÂ°8 and had a wonderfull three days in Venice. The hotel is in perfect shape and the staff is very friendly. Location is excellent, since it is in a quieter and more authentic neighbourhood and yet still very close to all majior attractions. One little remark however; I think there is a Nearby palazzo where they host parties and one night we had very loud music for some time. we would however recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “What the beautiful decor adds to the hotel the staff strip it to being the ugliest place to stay when visitng Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Anika17
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned First Class traveller I have visited some very wonderful destinations and had the privelege of staying in some of the best hotels (Four Season Koh Samui, One & Only Cape Town, Setai in Miami being a few of my favourites) around the world. So Palazzo Barbarigo did not leave me or my family gobsmacked in terms of its beauty and fantastic decor. What did leave us with a very poor taste in our mouth was the absolutely disgraceful behaviour of the staff. If you are not a hotel for children then please don't advertise "Children Welcome" and if you do mislead your guests in thinking that all of their family is welcome then please put a smile on your face and be a bit more hospitable! Valentina (who btw is just a receptionist) even had the audacity to say "we are so glad the weekend is over!". Perhaps in the current economic climate this hotel with all its arrogance does not need the revenue that a booking of 9 of its 16 rooms brings!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, quiet, almost seems like you are the only ones there”
Reviews.Author: MeanLady_12
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, quiet, almost seems like you are the only ones there. The staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke very good English. We had the junior suite, room 9, pretty spacious by European standards. The bed and pillows were comfortable, especially after a long day of walking around. There was a separate area for closets, suitcase storage, and getting dressed. The bathroom was a bit small for the size of room though, and there was no counter space. The hairdryer was nice, very strong.Â  The hotel is just a few minutes walk from the nearest vaporetto station, San Toma, and from various shops and restaurants. It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge and about 20-25 minutes from St. Marc's Square (San Marco), depending on how fast you walk. It is definitely worth making the walk all the way to St. Marc's Square at least once to see everything along they way. We found a great shop that was selling Dali clocks on that route. After that, the vaporetto's are definitely the way to go; it's not that difficult to figure out which one to take to get where you wanted to go. You should also take a trip to St Marc's Square at night; there are considerably fewer people there after dark. It's much easier to take pictures of things. With our "Indulge in Venice" package we got from the hotel, we got a bottle of wine, flowers, a "limo taxi" tour, one dinner, and transportation to/from the airport/train station. The "limo taxi" tour was extremely nice; we were able to take pictures of everything we wanted since it took us around the entire Grand Canal for about an hour or so. The transportation from the airport and then to the train station was oh so nice since we didn't have to try to cart our luggage around the city, over bridges, etc. It took us to the door of the hotel and to the steps of the train station.Â  Now for the dinner the hotel recommended, made the reservation for, and provided: the food was incredible. The food was so good, in fact, that we went back the next night for dinner again. The first night we went, we had two courses each, each had dessert, and a bottle of wine, all on the hotel. When we went back the next night, they weren't open yet, but they invited us in anyway. They were obviously still preparing to open... Putting out Citronella, still in their street clothes, etc. The lady there (we assume she was one of the owners) remembered us even though she didn't wait on our table before. She invited us back to the kitchen to see the vegetables they had that night and offered us samples. The waiter we had the night before remembered everything that we had ordered the night before. We ordered pretty much the same thing since we enjoyed it so much the night before. The restaurant name was "Trattoria da Ignazio". When we got back to the hotel, we tried to thank the lady who had recommended it to us, but we never saw her again.Â  This is also the first hotel we have seen in a very long time that has an actual key to the room. You do have the option of leaving it with the front desk when you leave and then picking it up when you return. The only somewhat negative comment we have is that the hotel was a little warm.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, welcoming, stunning. The perfect Venetian hotel”
Reviews.Author: katieenglish
Reviews.Content: We took two rooms here in early October. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, we loved it so much we (almost) wanted just to stay in our rooms. The hotel is quite small with an unusual layout, in that the bedrooms (or many of them, at least) are accessed through small lobbies leading off the bar. This doesn't make it noisy or inconvenient - just unusual. The bedrooms are a delight. Lovely bedding, comfortable beds, fantastic bathrooms - nothing more to say, really. The staff are welcoming and professional. Specifically, we found the bar staff to be friendly and efficient. Breakfast is great - loads of fruit, good coffee, everything we could ask for. The bar is absolutely beautiful - traditional Venetian done in the best modern Italian taste. Access -my advice is take a water taxi. It cost us â‚¬100 from the airport for all 4 of us, so it is expensive but it is a really great ride and you are delivered to the hotel's front door, which is inaccessible by any other way. The back door would be hard to find if you didn't know where to look. It is at the end of a fairly long alley with various turns - it's OK once you've gone out of it because you can find your way back. This is just because it is Venice, though. I imagine that access to many of the hotels on the Grand Canal is similar. I thoroughly recommend the hotel and will go back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Very very expensive posh hotel”
Reviews.Author: HongkongInvictus
Reviews.Content: If money is not a problem for you, then book and stay in this hotel. It is a Great hotel, very clean and well maintained. We had a suite which was on the Grand Canal. windows were so small, this was not worth the extra money paid To be on the Grand Canal. The views form the bar were much better. The hotel is dressed in dark and bordeau velvet, which make the surrounding posh but quiet dark. Breakfast is very good ( pastry, fruits, cold cut, cereals) and staff is friendly and helpful. Location is good, 10mn to Rialto bridge, 15mn from Accademia, 20-25mn from San Marco. Whether all this is worth the price we paid for , we thought not really.

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: MegHeidemann
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here on our honeymoon. it was our first stop in Italy and what a great start to the trip! The location is excellent. it is right on the water. It's away from the hussle and bussle so you have plenty of peace and quiet, but also very convenient to everything. we did not take a private water taxi to the hotel (which we later regreted!) we got very, very lost. it is very hard to find if it is your first time in Venice. We called the hotel and told them where we were and they had a bellman come right away and get our bags . We stayed in the suit, which was fabulous! Great view! Very sexy, modern design. The room was very clean. The shower was excellent and the mirror had a button that showcased a small t.v. it was fabulous. It reminded me of a James Bond movie. If you are looking for romance, look no further! The breakfast was delicious. plenty to eat. If you can go to the opera while in Venice, don't miss it. It was my favorite part of our two weeks in Italy. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous hotel right on the water”
Reviews.Author: Jennybasel
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights in this gorgeous sumptuous hotel right on a canal. It's quite difficult to find on foot but fun as it feels like a treasure hunt. Once inside, the hotels decor is very dark, velvety and elegant. The breakfast is delicious with lots of fresh fruit and plenty of breads etc. The view from the rooms is exquisite and the rooms themselves are very nice aswell. I thoroughly enjoyed staying here and would recommend it to everyone as the location is great too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, tasteful decor with good service”
Reviews.Author: Tezza287
Reviews.Content: Three night stay, very much a boutique hotel with tasteful decoration. Minor canal view room; noisy with boat traffic from 5am onwards if one has the window open, otherwise double glazing effective. Bathroom very nice and spacious. Bedroom big enough with large LCD tv. The continental breakfasts were very generous, no need for lunch! Staff helpful and friendly. Very nice bar with small terrace view of the Grand Canal. Only a small hotel but very cosy and warm, there was a nice library with lots of art and guide books. Would have liked a bottle of water in the room, and perhaps they could raise their game by providing an iPod or DVD player because the TV channels are mostly Italian, so one gets fed up with Sky News and BBC World. Access to the hotel is either by water taxi from Marco Polo a/p straight to the front door (100Euro) or by Vaporetto to San Toma and a long slog up alleyways with cases, first time around the entrance is not at all obvious, look out for the big red blob of paint at the entrance to the access alleyway. We enjoyed our stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Venice, but...”
Reviews.Author: Evergrande
Reviews.Content: There is no internet reception in certain rooms. Unacceptable in this day and age, right? Also the classic rooms are small, with no real view. But I liked the hotel design overall. Nice details and cool furnishings. The reception staff could be better trained. They were not exactly friendly. Maybe a language issue. For example I called from the bar phone to try to get the internet password, and the reception told me I am not permitted to use that phone. Hmm. Also I had to take a conference call late one evening. The reception couldn't locate me, and told the other party I was not a guest in the hotel. Hiccups like that. But the hardware is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: nsb1324
Reviews.Content: The hotel has got perfect location overlooking grand canal, very nice rooms and good hotel staff (Speaks/understands English, so that was great). Breakfast was very good. Nearby restaurants were good too. Also, arriving the hotel through water taxi was fun and unique.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Melani9111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 3 nights and it was too short of a stay. We happened to be in Venice during the Heineken music festival and it was awesome. To see Cyprus Hill sing Insane in the Membrane in Italian was awesome and then to see Black Eyed Peas - very cool. We even met some cool Americans while we were there. As for the hotel, it was beautiful. Highly recommended. From the moment we were picked up at the train to the breakfast to the stunning view out of the window to the canal. The hotel was centrally located and the bathroom was AWESOME. The shower was a welcome rain shower at the end of very warm and sweaty days. Many places in Italy dont have air conditioning like I am used to here in Florida but we got used to it. The hotel itself was always cool and just beautiful. We will definately stay here again!!! And the shopping here was incredible. Casablanca was nice and the staff was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic setting on the Grand Canal, great service & attentive staff - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Ali_23h
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel by speed boat, after reading other reviews, I would agree that this is the best way to arrive at the hotel as you see the wonderful exterior in all its splendour. We were welcomed by the owner and this was an effiicient check in process and then shown to our room which had a lovely view of the canal. The room was extremely stylish and they have paid good attention to detail, with a lovely comfy bed, nice decor and good toiletries. There was a flat screen TV , but no music, one idea would be to provide an ipod dock. The bathroom was lovely. Breakfast was really good, a huge selection of fresh fruit, pastries and fresh juice and coffee/tea. Staff very attentive. We had a drink at the bar one evening which is very nice and stylish. Also sat out on the balcony looking onto the canal and ate breakfast there in the sun one morning. Overall, this hotel is very stylish and romantic and is very well located for seeing the sights of Venice. Would return and recommend highly for a great stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Brit2989
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon and were quite disappointed with the service and breakfast here. The hotel receptionists were helpful when asked but did not take the initiative in sorting things out for us. Breakfast was especially disappointing - coffee was awful which is particularly bad for an Italian hotel! The milk and juice were all uht and tasted dreadful - in a country renowned for its food, it is really poor to be served such a substandard breakfast! The service at breakfast was average. They booked us a very nice restaurant - Centro Restaurant Lounge which, despite not sounding Italian at all, was lovely and was right on one of the canals which was amazing! The food was great and we were treated so well, including free limoncello which was a welcome surprise! Would definitely recommend the restaurant but wouldn't follow the map from the hotel because it's wrong! The rooms were nice but had an awful smell - whether this was from the hotel's drains or coming up from the canal, I don't know! There were a couple of plug-in air fresheners in the room but they didn't do much to mask the smell. We had a great time in Venice and would definitely return but would choose a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Glamour”
Reviews.Author: BindiB
Reviews.Content: We were so glad we picked this hotel. Our travel agent emailed us a special 4 night for 3 rate and it was well worth the money and staying 4 nights is a great benefit as you can take sightseeing at a more leisurely pace. Location is brilliant. Fairly quiet - difficult to find though via the street entrance - enlarge the google map. What views of the Grand Canal from the bar! The mirrored ceiling enlivens the space with ripples reflected from the Canal. There are few better places to enjoy a drink after a long day. Our room was not so big but well furnished with an extremely comfortable bed. We had a view of the side canal. The bathrooms are quite dark but modern lighting enhances the mood and they are high tech. We really liked the lit shower head. The staff were efficient and we also enjoyed the fact that breakfast is served to your table. You sit on black velvet chairs and the tables are glossy black. The whole hotel has a modern but opulent feel to it and such a brilliant change from the "olde worlde" dinginess of some Venetian Hotels. Would recommend this Hotel to anyone who appreciates quality without pastiche. The San Polo area has many delights, slightly less visited churches and palazzos, and good places to eat but menus can be predictable! We also took the train to Padua for a day. 2.80E each - a bargain. Padua is brilliant too - checkout the Chapel with Giotto's frescos and the University tour. We had our best meal there and were the only tourists in the restaurant. If you have the time, this is worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish design in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LarKir
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three day trip to Venice - our first visit to this fascinating city. Arrived by water taxi (hang the cost - just do it!) which is magical as the entrance is right on the grand canal. Location is superb as it is not right in the centre of the throng of either San Marco or the Rialto area but within easy walk of each. Lovely views from our room and the service and style of the hotel are first class. One minor quibble - no music in the rooms other than turning on the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in venice”
Reviews.Author: BradandLisa_26
Reviews.Content: Ok, It might be a big call, however this place exemplifies great accommodation. Although a small hotel, the service is very personalized and the help you receive from the front desk is brilliant. One regret is that we didn't arrive to the hotel by boat which would have been beautiful. So, I would suggest you do this to ensure you experience the full display of what this place has to offer. Another minor positive was the experience of having a tv in the bathroom. An avid sports fan I was able to watch the soccer and rugby while in the shower or brushing my teeth!! Something different from back home. One small negative was the fact that there was no wifi in the room and you had to go up to the bar to use wifi. however I did this from the balcony watching the gondolas and boats pass by which was well worth it! Overall a top spot and one I would recommend to any couple. safe travels, Bradandlisa

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travellergirl75
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews on trip advisor we decided to book this hotel for the first stop on or Italian honeymoon. As we were driving we left the car at the car park outside venice , jumped on the boat and we were arrived at the stop for the hotel within 20 minutes. The hotel isn't the easiest to find , to get in via the back route you need to navigate your way through a tiny alley way, we found the map on our IPhone was a great help and we were never lost. The hotel is beautiful and very well kept . Modern , clean and the staf are really friendly. The room was perfect for our needs , we have a side view of the canal , a TV with english speaking channels , there was even a free movie channel. The only thing that we thought was strange was that for a hotel of this standard although there were slippers there was no bathrobes , a small touch but would have made a difference. breakfast was gorgeous , fresh fruit , cheese , ham cereal , juice and a coffee of your choice. Its in a great location close to shops , supermarkets and all the sites.My only complaint about the hotel staff is on the day we were leaving ,we went to the front desk and asked about the passenger boat to the carpark , we were told that there was a general strike and that the only way to get back to the car park was via an expensive private boat. It would have been helpful for the hotel to have made visitors aware of this the day before , as we obviously hadn't watched the local news . Whilst I was chatting to the receptionist a passenger boat went past the door , I asked why there were boats if there was a general strike , she said that there were unlikely to be any boats in the morning. I was adament that we weren't going to pay for a private boat so we went to the public boat stop and got a boat within 5 minutes ...saving us over 40 euros .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with great location and views”
Reviews.Author: David46325
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the amenities great. When you arrive to venice you should take a water taxi to the front of the hotel because the rear entrance will be impossible to find the first time you are there. The hotel staff is helpful and very nice. The breakfast is first class. You won't be disappointed with your stay. We would go back to the hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Start to our Honeymooon”
Reviews.Author: jimchapp
Reviews.Content: Just a minute from the San Tomo waterbus stop, this place is wonderful. We stayed in room 14 which had a canal view, but it was a side canal, not the Canal Grande as i had expected. This didnt bother us as the room was fantastic, very dark and moody, which gave it a great atmosphere. The bed was 4 poster, with a huge LCD TV on the wall opposite. The bathroom was also very trendy, with a huge walk in shower. The continental breakfast was also pretty substantial, served to the table and not buffet style. Bacon, eggs and anything cooked was supplementary. We didnt need anything further as the breads, croissants, cold meats, fruit platter and cakes were more than enough, along with the excellent coffee. All we could have done with was a larger table to fit this spread on.... The Hotel bar was also very chic, although very empty both evenings we used it, although the barman was very friendly. There was a very romantic balcony at the end of the bar which only seats two, overlooking the Canal Grande. All in all a great hotel, and a great base for exploring Venice. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Venice style boutique hotel with glamour!”
Reviews.Author: burgsSydney
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel in Venice, the position was so convenient, the room decorated so gorgeously and the bathroom amenities were amazing - we loved the TV in the bathroom mirror! wow! The staff are so friendly, helpful and recommended the most delicious authentic restaurants. The breakfast was wonderful and the view of the grand canal lke a dream! A very special hotel in Venice, a very special city. I would highly recomend this hotel to our family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Boutique Hotel - Most Romatic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: templebar8
Reviews.Content: Once we finally found the hotel (at the end of a twisting, narrow alley), we never wanted to leave. This is one of the most beautiful boutique hotels we have stayed at anywhere in the world. There is no way to describe the surreal beauty of turning into the lobby and seeing the lit up canal and gondolas through the open doors. Though we arrived very late, we were greeted warmly and taken up the stairs to our room on the second floor. Our room was right off the modern restaurant/bar. The room, just like every other detail at this hotel, was meticulously decorated in what can best be described as contemporary Italian. The materials throughout, from the wood floors, fabrics, lighting and fixtures are of the highest quality. We had traveled for over 18 hours and upon seeing the room, completely forgot about our exhaustion. The entire staff was fabulous, helpful, warm and along with the hotel, made our stay in Venice one of the most memorable we've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: FDFLONDON
Reviews.Content: This luxury hotel is fantastic in every respect, right on the Grand Canal, close to San Toma Vaporetto stop and a Traghetto crossing, just a short stroll from Rialto and Accademia. The hotel is small, contemporary, well managed and quiet. Breakfast is superb - no tacky buffet here. Bar overlooks the Grand Canal and has a tiny balcony in the sun overlooking the continual boat parade of the Grand Canal. It accommodates 2 people but was always free when we wanted it. Forget the chintzy gin palaces of St Marks and stay here. Yes its hard to find on foot - but the best things in life are - and once you do find it you are in for a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique in great location”
Reviews.Author: dsbali
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 2 night stay for our first trip to Venice. This is a stylish, modern, tasteful boutique hotel in a fantastic location over looking the canal. The room was a good size with great quality bedding. Little touches like the huge flatscreen tv and tv within the bathroom mirror were cool. Breakfast was very very good - amazing pastries (some of the best we've had in a hotel breakfast) and coffee, fresh fruit, eggs to order - all brought to your table immediately. The bar area is nice and overall ambience is quiet (amazing sound proofing as we heard none of the usual annoying hotel sounds even though breakfast / bar area were a few meters from our room). The only slight negatives were the temperature control in the room - we found our room got too hot and the cooling system didn't allow us to turn the ac on as it was not yet summer. And on the first night we got bitten by mosquitoes in the room - although for the 2nd night they put something in the room for this and we were fine. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venetian Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: fl1mflam
Reviews.Content: This place is special, as it should be given the price. Super-stylish contemporary Venetian style - lots of velvet and polished plaster. Truly nice staff, great breakfast served with a smile no matter how late we got up.....even a cup of tea ordered at 4pm arrived in bone china with an unexpected tray of cakes which would do Claridges justice. Views of the grand canal with walls so thick we could sit on our window sill and watch the other crazy December tourists go drifting by. Possible downsides for some: no restaurant, front door tres chic but accessible only by water taxi (silly money), back door not signposted but accessible by alleyway provided you haven't overdone the gnocchi the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a non-cheesy, sexy and yet super comfy boutique property in Venice”
Reviews.Author: www.chubbyhubby.net
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Barbarigo is a truly plush and super-comfy boutique hotel, and one of the best Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. Itâ€™s gorgeously located right on the Grand Canal, a 10-15 walk from Rialto bridge, and past some of my favourite shops. The closest vaparetto station is San Toma, just 2 minutes away (and around the corner from the best chocolatier in Venice). The overall decor is dark -- if you like light themes, this is not the place for you -- with nice accents of bold colors and mirrors. It is very fantastical. The mix of old and new works very well here. The rooms are modern, chic and romantic. No cheese here (thank God). Very nice... very good for heading back for pre-dinner siestas or lots of frolicking. These are rooms you enjoy being in. The bathroom could be bigger but it's modern and stylish. The water pressure (important to me) is strong and the water hot. The heating / air conditioning in the room works well. There is also free wifi, which is a huge plus. The breakfasts are bountiful and really yummy. Huge spread with breads, cheese, fruit, local meats. Good coffee. Brekkie is served on the 2nd floor. What I love about small hotels is that you don't have to go far to get anything you need. Walk from my room to brekkie was like 10 steps. :-) The bar is nice too. And the bartender, Marco, not only makes one of the best Rossinis in Venice, heâ€™s also a great guy all around. The reception / Front Desk staff were all super-nice and accomodating. I had them calling restaurants constantly, changing, cancelling or making reservations for me at restaurants and they did all of it without ever complaining. It was very amusing when we arrived because the waters were so high, we couldn't come in through the picture-perfect Grand Canal jetty. Our water taxi had to swing around the side of the hotel and we came in through a bedroom window. Can you believe that? We booked Barbarigo through boutique-hotel specialists Mr and Mrs Smith and we are so very happy to have found it. Iâ€™m definitely staying there with each return visit from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: Spurs321
Reviews.Content: Looking for somewhere special to celebrate my 50th birthday, the Barbarigo seemed to offer just what I wanted, luxury on the Grand Canal and something slightly different. The hotel did not disappoint. From our arrival by water taxi (I would highly recommend this as, as well as making it special, it would be rather hard to find the hotel for the first time from the land), to the opulent, boutique bedroom, and the beautifully presented breakfast, everything was wonderful. The staff were charming and friendly and the location of the hotel was perfect. The attention to detail was really impressive. All the furnishings complemented each other and everything was presented with a meticulous eye for detail. As for the price, the hotel is reasonably expensive, but you get what you pay for (in fact, taking into account the views of the Grand Canal and the presentation of the hotel, I think you actually get quite a bit more than you pay for). Any trip to Venice is special and if you want to make it just that little bit more special at not too great a price I could not recommend this hotel more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - but the bad smell reared it's ugly head”
Reviews.Author: bizzy5
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not disappoint in terms of design and location - it was fantastic. Our room was large, with separate dressing area and 2 wardrobes, great bathroom, very comfy bed and a chaise longue too. Fabulous views of the Grand Canal from the room. I had previous reviews and sincerely hoped that the bad smell problem had either been solved or we would be lucky and not experience it - sadly neither was the case. It does indeed smell like a dead animal, though apparently originates from the heating system which connects to something smelly under the building. Management reacted by bringing out the overpowering air freshener, which was not great. We solved it by keeping the heating off and opening the windows - the hotel was so warm that we were fine. I do agree that service can be a bit frosty - and we did ask twice that our windows be left open when we were out for the day to air the room and reduce the smell - on both occasions they were closed, which was frustrating. The do seem to be working hard to sort out the smell but were frustrated that we were not happy just with the air freshener - they were distinctly grumpy when I mentioned that I had read about the smell in other reviews too. I recommend that the management leave a comment on Tripadvisor when the smell problem is resolved, because this is otherwise a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great facilities, good location & really helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Swiss_Tony_Brum
Reviews.Content: Hotel facilities were excellent. Breakfast was plentiful and good quality. Staff were brilliant - prompt service with any queries/problems no matter what time of day. Only problem - don't try to find land entrance at night, you've got no chance. Definitely get a taxi to the front door when you first arrive. Overall, would definitely recommend this to friends and family. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, great position, very nicely appointed.”
Reviews.Author: JPK63
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a trip to celebrate our silver wedding anniversary. It is a very small boutique hotel well positioned on the Grand Canal. Our room (No. 1) was a large corner one with quality furniture and stunning views of the canal both day and night. The interior design of the hotel is excellent, there is a small lift to the first floor. Breakfast was good, dinner is not served in the hotel but there is a small bar open in the evening with an intimate balcony for two overlooking the canal. Arrive by water taxi if you can for the lovely entrance on the canal but there are water bus stops nearby too. Good base for exploring the city on foot. The rear entrance is down long narrow alleys but that's similar for many places in Venice. I would recommend the hotel highly, staff were helpful and we had a special time there.

Reviews.Title: “True 'male' design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dublin TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If Palazzo Barbarigo were a perfume, it would be a Paco Rabanne: dark, mysterious and perhaps a little over-whelming. There is no question that this hotel is design from top to bottom with prices to match. Still, no point in doing Venice on a shoe-string - if you're going to weekend in Venice, you may as well go the whole hog and splurge. Mind you, one hates being ripped off - and Wifi at â‚¬70 is just that. Apart from that, no real complaints. Service was unobtrusive and v. professional. Rooms were of average size, furnished in dark, sombre palates with touches of art-deco (and unfortuantely a somewhat over-bearing air freshner). Location is superb. If you're trying to impress your significant other, just get the vaporetto taxi from the airport for â‚¬95 and it will pull up outside the front door. Although the decor is not to my taste, I cannot fault it - I have to admire hotels that are not afraid to have a true identity - a dark mysterious one at that.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem --a reason to splurge in Venice”
Reviews.Author: WJ912001
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in mid July 2009 as part of our Europe tour. The Palazzo Barbarigo is a sleek, sophisticated, and discreet hotel situated right on the Grand Canal. We lucked out on a great rate and found ourselves enjoying a level of luxury (in Venice of all places!) we normally would not splurge for. Just the ticket for a romantic getaway. Location: "Hidden gem" is a very appropriate term here. Yes, alighting onto the private dock from a water taxi via the Grand Canal is the grandest and most expensive option, but for those of us looking for an authentic (and cheaper) Venetian alleyway maze alternative, the Palazzo Barbarigo also delivers. The hotel's land entrance is at the end of a long, narrow alley with 2 sharp turns. More generally, the hotel is located in the San Polo area, a bit far from San Marco, but allowing us a chance to explore Venice by foot and vaporetto. Hotel: Professionally designed with sleek, sultry undertones. Reception area on first floor faces the water entrance. Arriving on foot by land definitely feels like the back entrance. Building is short - only 2 floors. Sophisticated bar and breakfast room on the 2nd floor. You absolutely must have a cafe or cocktail on the balcony overlooking the Grand Canal as the boats putter by below. Bar area was mostly deserted during our stay. Room: We booked a Classic room which had a view of a side canal and a partial view of the Grand Canal. The room just oozes discreet refinement. 4 poster bed with luxurious sheets and bedding. With sleek, black furniture, polished to a glossy sheen, the room manages to successfully pull off feathered boa lampshades and felt printed wallpaper without coming across as a bordello. Black granite in the bathroom and a small flatscreen TV embedded in the bathroom mirror completed the room. Kudos to the designers. Service: A bit cold at reception. We couldn't tell if it was because we arrived on foot and were not wearing designer clothes or if the staff is trained to be distant. They are certainly unobtrusive and discreet...sometimes to the point of not being around when you need them. Like for check-out or for a drink at the bar. Also, the guy at reception tactlessly announced that "yes, you have the 'no-frills' room rate" at check-in. Internet: Free wifi...if you can get a signal. As mentioned by previous reviewer, the router is in the bar/lounge area and signal in the non-suite rooms is dismal. Value: As stated above, we managed to book a "No-frills" rate of 120 euros for a Classic room that normally starts at 170 euros. "No-frills" simply meant breakfast was not included, which was fine for us, as we were absolutely satisfied with the luxury 4-star accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a tragic flaw”
Reviews.Author: nysteve
Reviews.Content: Excellent, location, great staff, beautiful small boutique hotel. We had 2 very nice rooms for a couple of days. The 1 very big problem, one of the rooms smelled beyond belief, which they acknowledged as an on-going problem that skipped around from room to room. The smell was comparable to a dead animal carcass rotting and could not be covered up with the deodorizers they tried to use. It was a shame since the second room we had had no smell. Would probably not recommend or stay there again unless there was a guarantee on the odor.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels ever”
Reviews.Author: richeyint
Reviews.Content: From the first step, we felt in love with the hotel. The dÃ©cor was so romantic and modern that I doubt that there is someone that does not like it. The room was very nice and comfortable. There is not one single thing I would change. Breakfast was very special and good. The staff was always helpful although we had a little trouble on the first day to speak English on the phone with the receptionist so that he could explain us the way to the hotel. Should you not arrive by taxi, make sure that you get the directions to the hotel before arriving as it is not very easy to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: rudetechnicals
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Barbarigo for three nights with our 20 month old. This was our 6th visit to to Venice and our first with the baby. We had a lovely warm welcome from the exceptionally helpful and friendly staff. Like other reviewers I would recommend the water taxi from the airport. It's expensive but it's the best way to get into the city and will save you an age hunting about for the back door on foot (once you've gone out that way once it's easy to find). The hotel is contemporary and luxurious and even though we stayed in a standard room it was very comfortable and spacious. Once we had put the baby to bed we sat at what must be the best table in Venice: on a small balcony overlooking the Grand Canal drinking Belini's.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel - to match a buzzing Venice”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_NI
Reviews.Content: Arrive via water taxi, a must or you will not find the alley way entrance, to be impressed by the black and velvet lobby, adorned with design books. Rooms have all you need for a relaxing stay, clean and sleek yet still with that boutique feel. Bathroom mirror with TV screen embedded. Explore Venice and then return to Palazzo Barbarigo for a drink on the balcony looking over the Grand Canal. Staff very pleasant and Knowledgeable advising us on an excellent restaurant with, most importantly, accurate directions. A must stay for those who enjoy that touch of luxury especially in this hectic city.

Reviews.Title: “Tasteful property”
Reviews.Author: greece4ever
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite at the Palazzo Barbarigo. Upon arrival we were shown to what it was actually a specious room with a window overlooking the grand canal, and thus we were a bit disappointed, because the term junior suite is not very accurate, as it is just a room with a view over the grand canal. From the floor plan, there were some luxury rooms on the side canal that seemed quite more spacious, so if space is your priority don't be confused by the meanings. Although not a proper suite, our room had a very dramatic decor and it was flawless, and of course had the very venetian grand canal view. The bathroom was also nicely done, although as pointed out by previous reviewers a bathtub could have been nice. Breakfast was excellent quality, especially for a 18room hotel, and staff was helpful and informal. A top notch hotel, especially for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful !!!”
Reviews.Author: alainleroy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful design hotel ! A must have. A gorgeous design hotel, very clean, romantic and central (between Academia and Rialto bridges). Furthermore, traghetti all over. The bedroom is fully equipped and the architecture of the hotel is so elegant ! At least, the personal is polite and helpful. Breakfast is splendid. Recommended for all the design and fashion lovers !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilly5
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Barbarigo is a beautifully, modern hotel right on the Grand Canal. The location is fabulous: It's out of the crowded tourist area, but close enough to everything to not feel isolated. I am so happy that we chose this hotel over some of the larger hotels near St. Mark's, as that area is horribly crowded during the summer. The interior of the hotel is very sleek and sexy. I would definitely recommend splurging for a suite overlooking the Grand Canal. We did not do this and definitely regretted it upon arrival. The standard rooms are very nice, but they are a little small and, most importantly, they do not have that lovely Grand Canal view that you want so badly to see every time you look out your window, so definitely splurge for a suite if you can. As for the staff, I have very mixed feelings. The woman at the front desk was absolutely wonderful. She guided us to a fantastic restaurant our first night and helped us secure a lovely gondola ride. She also helped us book a water taxi for our morning departure. The gentleman who manned the front desk when she was not around, however, was horrible. He basically wanted to collect a paycheck for surfing the internet. I found him to rude and not helpful at all. Every time my husband or I approached him for information he seemed annoyed that I was interrupting him while he was on the computer. He should frankly be let go, as he is currently detracting from this hotel's otherwise flawless environment. All in all, my husband and I had a lovely stay at this hotel and we would definitely stay here again (in a suite) if we were ever to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelHK
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel - v posh and stylish. The room had a huge flat screen tv, and there was also a tv in the bathroom (we stayed in a normal room). The bed was also v comfortable - egyptian cotton sheets. Location is also good - close to the Rialto Bridge (5 mins walk) and a vaporetto stop (3 mins). Walking to San Marco (where all the main touristy sites are) is about 20 mins away. If you decide to walk to and from the hotel, you will need to pass through a narrow alley (which can appear to be a bit scary at first), but we did not find that to be a problem because some of the streets in Venice are like that....so it just added to the Venetian experience for us. We asked for some hot tea to be delivered to our room one evening, and were pleasantly surprised to find that our tea came with a few slices of lemon cake. Both the tea and the cake were complimentary. Would definately return to this hotel when we are next in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Venice Gem”
Reviews.Author: kannm
Reviews.Content: We celebrated my husband's birthday here in mid-June with his family and mine. First of all, we were able to get an amazing rate (although we had to prepay in full) for this hotel so we started off on a good foot. The hotel itself is lovely. I would strongly suggest getting an airport transfer by boat through the hotel -- because, as others have mentioned, finding the back entrance is nearly impossible. The rooms are beautiful/ the maid service is polite/ the mini bar is well stocked/ huge flat screen, TV built into the bathroom mirror. The staff, in particular, the bartender in the second floor bar/ lounge area are helpful and attentive. We had amazing drinks on the balcony overlookin the grand canal. The was my second time in Venice. My first we stayed at the Hotel Danieli - which is a grand old hotel, but I have to say I prefered here (with the exception being the location -- you can't beat the Danieli). In terms of things they could improve -- they need to have the internet in all rooms -- as it is you have to go to the desk and get a 1 hour password to use in the bar -- this is silly. Secondly, they need to serve some sort of small bar menu.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: thomas1980London_UK
Reviews.Content: Couldn't recommend this place more highly. Great position, design, rooms and very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dikons
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, young, fresh, beutifully designed, great location...get a junior suite and u ll never regret it

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Palazzo Barbarigo Sul Canal Grande
HotelInfo.Address: San Polo 2765, 30125 Venice, Italy
